sentences.english: The essay is most penetrating and powerful.
sentences.chinese: 这篇杂文极为深刻有力。

sentences.english: This chapter dwells on the power of Lu Xun's essays.
sentences.chinese: 这一章详细论述鲁迅杂文的威力。

sentences.english: Almost all of Luxun's essays were directed at the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 鲁迅的杂文绝大部分是对准敌人的。

sentences.english: The Pi Rixiu's essay made the special contribution in the development of later Tang dynasty literature.
sentences.chinese: 皮日休的杂文创作对晚唐文坛发展有着特殊的贡献。

sentences.english: The essay bitterly satirized some unhealthy tendencies in society.
sentences.chinese: 这篇杂文辛辣地讽刺了社会上的一些不良现象。

sentences.english: This background had also determined the public characteristics of Lu Xun's essays in his later writing stage.
sentences.chinese: 这种背景也决定了鲁迅后期杂文的公共性特征。

sentences.english: Today, as we re-read these two articles, we are even more deeply moved.
sentences.chinese: 现在，重新拜读两篇杂文，更加让人百感交集。

sentences.english: His essays from this period are a plain-spoken pleasure, despite their contradictions.
sentences.chinese: 他的杂文前后存在着矛盾的说法，却坦率表达了意愿。

sentences.english: Arriage is a book of which the first chapter is written in poetry and remaining chapters in prose.
sentences.chinese: 婚姻这本书，第一章是诗歌，其馀的全是杂文。

sentences.english: Almost all of Lu Xun's essays were directed at the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 鲁迅的杂文绝大部分矛头是置于敌人的。

definition: a pre-Tang Dynasty genre of poetry, relatively free in form, usually having four, five, six or seven characters per line
